Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    A STUN server that accepts STUN binding requests on default port 3478 and responds with a binding response
    Author:
    Frans

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Server()
      Empty constructor if you want to use default InetAddress and STUN port 3478
      Server(java.net.InetAddress myAddress, int myPort)
      Constructor if you want to specify which network interface to use and which port Port number 3478 is Strongly Recommended!

    • Method Summary

      For debugging reasons.

      For debugging reasons Setting the Level on the ConsoleHandler
      static void setLogLevel(java.util.logging.Level newLevel)
      For debugging reasons Setting the Level on the Logger
      void shutdown()
      This method shuts down the Server immediately.
      void startServer()
      This method starts the STUN server.

    • Method Detail

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method starts the STUN server. It starts a thread pool with more than 4 threads and creates nrOfThreads/2 TCP listeners and nrOfThreads/2 UDP listeners It will by default use port 3478 + nrOfThreads ports and if specific port is requested port+nrOfThreads.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for Sockets

      • connectConsoleHandler

        public static void connectConsoleHandler()
        For debugging reasons. Connect Handler to Logger in order to see Level.FINE messages

      • setLogLevel

        public static void setLogLevel(java.util.logging.Level newLevel)
        For debugging reasons Setting the Level on the Logger
        Parameters:
        newLevel -

      • setConsoleHandlerLevel

        public static void setConsoleHandlerLevel(java.util.logging.Level newLevel)
        For debugging reasons Setting the Level on the ConsoleHandler
        Parameters:
        newLevel -

      • getInetList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.net.InetAddress> getInetList()
        Fills an ArrayList with the available network interfaces and returns it
        Returns:
        ArrayList with available network interfaces

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.io.IOException
        This method shuts down the Server immediately. It closes all sockets which makes it possible for the ThreadPool to close. All requests that are processes during shutdown will be lost.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for Socket

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
